params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the entity to update.

params.name: namespace
params.doc: Identifier for the app whose extended fields are being updated.

examples.title: updateExtendedFields example for dashboard page code
body: const result = await charges.updateExtendedFields(id, namespace, options);

examples.title: updateExtendedFields example for exporting from backend code
body: const result = await elevatedUpdateExtendedFields(id, namespace, options);

members.name: email
members.doc: The email of an Account used by Payment Method

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: token
members.doc:
the payment token
[!] This field is only used during charge creation and is not a part of the charge object.

members.name: bin
members.doc: Card BIN (Bank Identification Number). It's the first 4-8 digits of a card number.

members.name: cardholderName
members.doc: Card holder's full name specified on the card.

members.name: expirationMonth
members.doc: Card expiration month.

members.name: expirationYear
members.doc: Card expiration year.

members.name: lastFourDigits
members.doc: Card last 4 digits.

members.name: networkReference
members.doc: Reference to transaction on network's side associated with this charge.

members.name: expiryMonth
members.doc: the month of the card expiration date

members.name: expiryYear
members.doc: the full year of the card expiration date

members.name: holderName
members.doc: the cardholder name printed on the card

members.name: numberToken
members.doc: the card number token

members.name: securityCodeToken
members.doc: the CVV/CVC/CID token

members.name: locationId
members.doc: Location ID.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: terminalId
members.doc: Terminal ID.

members.name: createIntentOnly
members.doc: whether create intent only or complete transaction (use this flag only if you know what it means)

members.name: locationId
members.doc: the location ID

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: the service ID

members.name: terminalId
members.doc: the terminal ID

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the charge was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Charge ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the charge was last updated.

members.name: accountConnectionId
members.doc: Merchant's account connection ID.

members.name: additionalCharges
members.doc: Additional charges to the order - e.g., tax, shipping or discount.

members.name: applicationFee
members.doc:
Amount of the application fee in base units.
E.g. "12.95".
Application fee is the fee that the platform charges for the transaction.
Application fee is part of the amount represented by line items total amount + additional charges.

members.name: authorizationAmount
members.doc:
Authorization amount of the charge in base units.
E.g. "12.95".

members.name: barcodeDisplay
members.doc: A browser should display a barcode / barcode url to continue payment.

members.name: billingInfo
members.doc: Billing information.

members.name: buyerInfo
members.doc: Buyer information used to notify buyer about payment and to store payment credentials on file.

members.name: capturedAmount
members.doc:
Amount that was already captured.
E.g. "12.95".

members.name: cardReaderInteraction
members.doc: A client should interact with card reader.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency of the charge.

members.name: delayedCapture
members.doc: Indicates that capture shouldn't be performed automatically immediately after successful authorization.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Data Extensions.

members.name: fulfillmentDate
members.doc: Timestamp on which event/delivery/ect. happens and order is considered fulfilled

members.name: getMethodRedirect
members.doc: A browser should issue an HTTP GET request and render the result.

members.name: installment
members.doc: Number of installments.

members.name: items
members.doc: Order line items.

members.name: moto
members.doc: Indicates if the charge is a mail order/telephone order (MOTO).

members.name: offSession
members.doc:
Indicates if the charge is off-session.
Off-session charges are charges that are initiated by the merchant on behalf of the customer
e.g. charging a customer for a late fee or an incidental for a car rental
or automatically e.g. subscription renewal.

members.name: paymentAgreementId
members.doc: Payment agreement which was used to create the charge if it exists.

members.name: paymentIntentId
members.doc: PaymentIntent which was used to create the charge if it exists.

members.name: paymentMethod
members.doc: Payment method data that is used to create this charge.

members.name: paymentMethodInfo
members.doc: Payment method information enriched with data from the payment provider.

members.name: postMethodRedirect
members.doc: A browser should issue an HTTP POST request and render the result.

members.name: qrCodeDisplay
members.doc: A browser should show a QR code to continue payment.

members.name: returnUrls
members.doc:
Redirect URLs for different payment outcomes. PSP-hosted payment pages use these URLs to redirect
the buyer back to the merchant’s site.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the charge is updated.
Ignored when creating a charge.

members.name: riskData
members.doc: Payment information for the risk evaluation score.

members.name: scaRequested
members.doc: Request charge to be made using strong customer authentication e.g. 3-D Secure.

members.name: setupFutureUsages
members.doc:
Indicates that you intend to make future payments with payment method used in this charge.
If it’s set to true than payment agreement will be created after charge succeeds.

members.name: shippingInfo
members.doc: Shipping information.

members.name: statementDescriptor
members.doc: Complete description that appears on the customers' statements.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the charge.
Read more about statuses in this [article](<https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/business-management/payments/charges/introduction#lifecycle-of-a-charge>). // todo

members.name: statusInfo
members.doc: Details about charge status.

members.name: unscheduledMit
members.doc: Indicates if the charge is an unscheduled merchant initiated payment.

members.name: webPageDisplay
members.doc:
A browser should display an iframe with web page.
Redirect shouldn't be performed as it's designed to be embedded into checkout page.

members.name: providerToken
members.doc: Tokens that are used to reference a payment agreement in external payment provider.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number as free text.

members.name: addressLine1
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number as free text.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name and number.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually a state, region, prefecture, or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

description:
A common address format to use if you plan to store addresses in your service

Physical address

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number as free text.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name and number.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: company
members.doc: Contact's company name.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email associated with the address.

members.name: firstName
members.doc: Contact's first name.

members.name: lastName
members.doc: Contact's last name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Contact's phone number.

members.name: vatId
members.doc: Tax info. Currently usable only in Brazil.

description: Full contact details for an address

You should have additional permission in order to get them as described in RequestedFields documentation.

the payment token

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ANONYMOUS_VISITOR'`
- `'APP'`
- `'MEMBER'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'WIX_USER'`
